title: Bug 3622 - New Package Wizard has confusing message
description:
Bug 3622 - New Package Wizard has a confusing message.

When invoking the 'New Java Package' wizard, the following message appears at the top: 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists'. However, at this point, the package name field is empty. It is unclear what this message means and whether it is an error. If it is an error, it should be displayed in red with the error icon.

Notes:
- EG (5/1/2001 5:53:41 AM): There should be no error message when the package name field is empty and the 'Finish' button should be disabled.
- MA (5/2/01 9:34:00 AM): It is a warning. I will remove the message.
- EG (5/2/01 9:43:44 AM): What is the issue with creating a default package? It can't be created by the user since it is always there.
OB: When invoking the 'New Java Package' wizard with an empty package name field, a message appears at the top stating 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists'.
EB: When invoking the 'New Java Package' wizard, no message should appear at the top when the package name field is empty. If there is an error, it should be displayed in red with the error icon.
SR:
1. Open the 'New Java Package' wizard.
2. Leave the package name field empty.
3. Verify that no message appears at the top.
4. If there is an error, it should be displayed in red with the error icon.
